criteria: Understanding and identifying linear equations with one variable.
Ability to solve linear equations in one variable.
Understanding different types of solutions (one solution, infinitely many, or no solution).
Ability to transform equations into simpler forms to determine the solution type.
descriptions: Does not demonstrate understanding of linear equations or variables.
Struggles to identify linear equations and variables.
Identifies linear equations and variables with some errors.
Correctly identifies linear equations and variables most of the time.
Consistently identifies linear equations and variables correctly.
Demonstrates a thorough understanding of linear equations and variables and can explain the concept effectively.
Unable to solve linear equations.
Attempts to solve equations, but makes significant errors.
Solves simple linear equations with some mistakes.
Solves most linear equations correctly with occasional errors.
Solves linear equations correctly and efficiently.
Solves complex linear equations accurately and can explain the steps clearly.
Does not understand the concept of different types of solutions.
Struggles to differentiate between the different solution types.
Identifies solution types with some errors.
Correctly identifies most solution types.
Consistently identifies the correct solution type for a given equation.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of different solution types and can provide examples.
Unable to transform equations into simpler forms.
Attempts to transform equations, but cannot simplify them effectively.
Simplifies equations with some errors.
Simplifies equations correctly most of the time.
Consistently transforms equations into simpler forms accurately.
Transforms equations efficiently and accurately to determine the solution type and can justify each step.
